newsitem.title: CANADA: Newbridge plans stake in wireless firm.
newsitem.headline: Newbridge plans stake in wireless firm.

text.p: Newbridge Networks Corp said on Wednesday it planned to take a minority equity stake in a Canadian firm that is an expert in very high-speed radio frequencies that could be useful for business communications.

"Our interest is in using that two-way transmission technology for business as opposed to (using) fibre optics," executive vice president Conrad Lewis told reporters at a technology seminar. He declined to name the company.
Lewis said the company was already well-positioned to supply groups that applied for Canadian licenses for the new wireless communications technology called LMCS.
